required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: A Safety and Effectiveness Study of JUVÉDERM VOLUMA® XC Injectable Gel for Chin Augmentation
clinical_study.official_title: A Multicenter, Single-blind, Randomized, Controlled Study of the Safety and Effectiveness of JUVÉDERM VOLUMA® XC Injectable Gel for Chin Augmentation

brief_summary.textblock: This is a safety and effectiveness study of JUVÉDERM VOLUMA XC injectable gel for chin augmentation to correct volume deficit in chin retrusion.

primary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Participants With a ≥ 1-point Improvement (Decrease) on the Allergan Chin Retrusion Scale (ACSR) Score
primary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline (up to 30 days prior to randomization) to Month 6
primary_outcome.description: The evaluating investigator assessed the participant's chin retrusion based on 2-dimensional (2D) renderings of 3-dimensional (3D) images using the validated 5-point photonumeric ACRS where: 0= None (no chin retrusion) to 4=Extreme (extreme chin retrusion).

secondary_outcome.measure: Change From Baseline in Overall Scores of the Satisfaction With Chin Module of the FACE-Q Questionnaire
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline (up to 30 days prior to randomization) to Month 6
secondary_outcome.description: The participant answered 10 question on the chin module of the FACE-Q about their satisfaction with their chin using a 4-point scale where: 1=Very Dissatisfied, 2=Somewhat Dissatisfied, 3=Somewhat Satisfied and 4=Very Satisfied. The total score was transformed to a score of 0 (worse) to 100 (best). A positive change from Baseline indicates improvement.

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Participants Improved or Much Improved on the 5-Point Global Aesthetic Improvement Scale (GAIS) for the Chin Area As Assessed by the Evaluating Investigator
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline (up to 30 days prior to randomization) to Month 6
secondary_outcome.description: The evaluating investigator assessed the participant's chin area using the GAIS where: 2=Much Improved, 1=Improved, 0=No change, -1=Worse and -2=Much Worse.

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Participants Improved or Much Improved on the 5-Point GAIS for the Chin Area As Assessed by the Participants
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline (up to 30 days prior to randomization) to Month 6
secondary_outcome.description: The participants who received JUVÉDERM VOLUMA® XC, assessed their chin area using the GAIS where: 2=Much Improved, 1=Improved, 0=No change, -1=Worse and -2=Much Worse.

arm_group.description: JUVÉDERM VOLUMA® XC was injected into the chin at a volume determined by the investigator on Day 0. Participants were eligible to receive touch-up treatment 30 days later, if applicable. The maximum total volume administered was up to 4 milliliters (mL) for both treatments combined.

arm_group.arm_group_label: No Treatment then JUVÉDERM VOLUMA® XC
arm_group.description: No treatment for 6 months followed by optional treatment with JUVÉDERM VOLUMA® XC injected into the chin at a volume determined by the investigator on Month 6. Participants were eligible to receive touch-up treatment 30 days later, if applicable. The maximum total volume administered was up to 4 mL for both treatments combined.

intervention.description: JUVÉDERM VOLUMA® XC was injected into the chin at a volume determined by the investigator. The maximum total volume administered was up to 4 mL.
intervention.arm_group_label: No Treatment then JUVÉDERM VOLUMA® XC

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Chin retrusion
- In good general health
Exclusion Criteria:
- Permanent facial implants on the face and/or neck
- Received fat injections below the nose
- Tattoos, piercings, beard, mustache, and/or scars on the face below the nose
- Received semi-permanent dermal fillers in the chin or jaw line in the last 3 years
- Undergone dermal filler injections or had any surgery in the chin or jaw area in the last 2 years
- Received dermal filler injections in the lips or in the mouth area in the last 12 months
- Undergone mesotherapy or cosmetic treatment (e.g., laser, photomodulation, intense pulsed light, radio frequency, dermabrasion, moderate or greater depth chemical peel, liposuction, lipolysis, or other ablative procedures) anywhere in the face or neck in the last 6 months
- Received botulinum toxin treatment below the nose in the last 6 months

facility.name: Dermatology Cosmetic Laser Medical Associates of La Jolla, Inc.
St Louis University Medical Center Dept. of Dermatology
The Center for Dermatology, Cosmetics, & Laser Surgery
Dermatology & Laser Center of Charleston Center for Clinical Research
Nashville Centre for Laser and Facial Surgery
Premier Clinical Research; Spokane Dermatology Clinic

participant_flow.recruitment_details: A total of 221 participants were enrolled in the study, with enrollment defined as signing the informed consent form. A total of 29 enrolled participants were screen failures (did not meet eligibility criteria). Thus, a total of 192 participants were randomized.

group.title: JUVÉDERM VOLUMA® XC
group.description: JUVÉDERM VOLUMA® XC was injected into the chin at a volume determined by the investigator on Day 0. Participants were eligible to receive touch-up treatment 30 days later, if applicable. The maximum total volume administered was up to 4 milliliters (mL) for both treatments combined.

group.title: No Treatment Then JUVÉDERM VOLUMA® XC
group.description: No treatment for 6 months followed by optional treatment with JUVÉDERM VOLUMA® XC injected into the chin at a volume determined by the investigator on Month 6. Participants were eligible to receive touch-up treatment 30 days later, if applicable. The maximum total volume administered was up to 4 mL for both treatments combined.

participants_list.participants: Includes participants who completed the study but did not receive the optional treatment.

baseline.population: Modified Intent-to-Treat (mITT) Population included all participants randomized to the treatment group who received at least 1 study treatment or all participants randomized to the control group.

group.title: JUVÉDERM VOLUMA® XC
group.description: JUVÉDERM VOLUMA® XC was injected into the chin at a volume determined by the investigator on Day 0. Participants were eligible to receive touch-up treatment 30 days later, if applicable. The maximum total volume administered was up to 4 mL for both treatments combined.

group.title: No Treatment Then JUVÉDERM VOLUMA® XC
group.description: No treatment for 6 months followed by optional treatment with JUVÉDERM VOLUMA® XC injected into the chin at a volume determined by the investigator on Month 6. Participants were eligible to receive touch-up treatment 30 days later, if applicable. The maximum total volume administered was up to 4 mL for both treatments combined.

category.title: Native Hawaiian or Other Pacific Islander

outcome.title: Percentage of Participants With a ≥ 1-point Improvement (Decrease) on the Allergan Chin Retrusion Scale (ACSR) Score
outcome.description: The evaluating investigator assessed the participant's chin retrusion based on 2-dimensional (2D) renderings of 3-dimensional (3D) images using the validated 5-point photonumeric ACRS where: 0= None (no chin retrusion) to 4=Extreme (extreme chin retrusion).
outcome.time_frame: Baseline (up to 30 days prior to randomization) to Month 6
outcome.population: The mITT population included all participants randomized to the treatment group who received at least 1 study treatment or all participants randomized to the control group. Overall number of participants analyzed were the participants with analysis values at both Baseline and Post-baseline during the specified time period.

group.title: JUVÉDERM VOLUMA® XC
group.description: JUVÉDERM VOLUMA® XC was injected into the chin at a volume determined by the investigator on Day 0. Participants were eligible to receive touch-up treatment 30 days later, if applicable. The maximum total volume administered was up to 4 mL for both treatments combined.

group.title: No Treatment Then JUVÉDERM VOLUMA® XC
group.description: No treatment for 6 months followed by optional treatment with JUVÉDERM VOLUMA® XC injected into the chin at a volume determined by the investigator on Month 6. Participants were eligible to receive touch-up treatment 30 days later, if applicable. The maximum total volume administered was up to 4 mL for both treatments combined.

measure.title: Percentage of Participants With a ≥ 1-point Improvement (Decrease) on the Allergan Chin Retrusion Scale (ACSR) Score
measure.description: The evaluating investigator assessed the participant's chin retrusion based on 2-dimensional (2D) renderings of 3-dimensional (3D) images using the validated 5-point photonumeric ACRS where: 0= None (no chin retrusion) to 4=Extreme (extreme chin retrusion).
measure.population: The mITT population included all participants randomized to the treatment group who received at least 1 study treatment or all participants randomized to the control group. Overall number of participants analyzed were the participants with analysis values at both Baseline and Post-baseline during the specified time period.

analysis.groups_desc: Superiority of treatment group was established if responder rate at month 6 was statistically greater than that for the control group at month 6 and the observed responder rate at month 6 for the treatment group was greater than 50%.
analysis.p_value_desc: If the 2-sided p-value is < 0.05, the responder rate is greater for treatment than for control group, and point estimate of the responder rater for treatment group is greater than 50%, then treatment will be considered superior to control group.

outcome.title: Change From Baseline in Overall Scores of the Satisfaction With Chin Module of the FACE-Q Questionnaire
outcome.description: The participant answered 10 question on the chin module of the FACE-Q about their satisfaction with their chin using a 4-point scale where: 1=Very Dissatisfied, 2=Somewhat Dissatisfied, 3=Somewhat Satisfied and 4=Very Satisfied. The total score was transformed to a score of 0 (worse) to 100 (best). A positive change from Baseline indicates improvement.
outcome.time_frame: Baseline (up to 30 days prior to randomization) to Month 6
outcome.population: The mITT population included all participants randomized to the treatment group who received at least 1 study treatment or all participants randomized to the control group. Overall number of participants analyzed were the participants with analysis values at both Baseline and Post-baseline during the specified time period.

group.title: JUVÉDERM VOLUMA® XC
group.description: JUVÉDERM VOLUMA® XC was injected into the chin at a volume determined by the investigator on Day 0. Participants were eligible to receive touch-up treatment 30 days later, if applicable. The maximum total volume administered was up to 4 mL for both treatments combined.

group.title: No Treatment Then JUVÉDERM VOLUMA® XC
group.description: No treatment for 6 months followed by optional treatment with JUVÉDERM VOLUMA® XC injected into the chin at a volume determined by the investigator on Month 6. Participants were eligible to receive touch-up treatment 30 days later, if applicable. The maximum total volume administered was up to 4 mL for both treatments combined.

measure.title: Change From Baseline in Overall Scores of the Satisfaction With Chin Module of the FACE-Q Questionnaire
measure.description: The participant answered 10 question on the chin module of the FACE-Q about their satisfaction with their chin using a 4-point scale where: 1=Very Dissatisfied, 2=Somewhat Dissatisfied, 3=Somewhat Satisfied and 4=Very Satisfied. The total score was transformed to a score of 0 (worse) to 100 (best). A positive change from Baseline indicates improvement.
measure.population: The mITT population included all participants randomized to the treatment group who received at least 1 study treatment or all participants randomized to the control group. Overall number of participants analyzed were the participants with analysis values at both Baseline and Post-baseline during the specified time period.

analysis.p_value_desc: P-value is based on a 2-sided paired t-test at the 5% level to demonstrate that the mean overall satisfaction score at month 6 visit is statistically greater than that at the baseline for the treatment group.

outcome.title: Percentage of Participants Improved or Much Improved on the 5-Point Global Aesthetic Improvement Scale (GAIS) for the Chin Area As Assessed by the Evaluating Investigator
outcome.description: The evaluating investigator assessed the participant's chin area using the GAIS where: 2=Much Improved, 1=Improved, 0=No change, -1=Worse and -2=Much Worse.
outcome.time_frame: Baseline (up to 30 days prior to randomization) to Month 6
outcome.population: The mITT population included all participants randomized to the treatment group who received at least 1 study treatment or all participants randomized to the control group. Overall number analyzed is the number of participants with data available for analyses.

group.title: JUVÉDERM VOLUMA® XC
group.description: JUVÉDERM VOLUMA® XC was injected into the chin at a volume determined by the investigator on Day 0. Participants were eligible to receive touch-up treatment 30 days later, if applicable. The maximum total volume administered was up to 4 mL for both treatments combined.

Participants were eligible to receive touch-up treatment 30 days later, if applicable. The maximum total volume administered was up to 4 mL for both treatments combined.

measure.description: The evaluating investigator assessed the participant's chin area using the GAIS where: 2=Much Improved, 1=Improved, 0=No change, -1=Worse and -2=Much Worse.
measure.population: The mITT population included all participants randomized to the treatment group who received at least 1 study treatment or all participants randomized to the control group. Overall number analyzed is the number of participants with data available for analyses.

outcome.description: The participants who received JUVÉDERM VOLUMA® XC, assessed their chin area using the GAIS where: 2=Much Improved, 1=Improved, 0=No change, -1=Worse and -2=Much Worse.
outcome.time_frame: Baseline (up to 30 days prior to randomization) to Month 6
outcome.population: Participants in the mITT population who were randomized to the treatment group and received at least 1 study treatment with available data were included in the analyses.

group.title: JUVÉDERM VOLUMA® XC
group.description: JUVÉDERM VOLUMA® XC was injected into the chin at a volume determined by the investigator on Day 0. Participants were eligible to receive touch-up treatment 30 days later, if applicable. The maximum total volume administered was up to 4 mL for both treatments combined.

measure.description: The participants who received JUVÉDERM VOLUMA® XC, assessed their chin area using the GAIS where: 2=Much Improved, 1=Improved, 0=No change, -1=Worse and -2=Much Worse.
measure.population: Participants in the mITT population who were randomized to the treatment group and received at least 1 study treatment with available data were included in the analyses.

reported_events.time_frame: JUVÉDERM VOLUMA® XC: Up to 12 months following treatment. No Treatment then JUVÉDERM VOLUMA® XC: Up to 6 months during No Treatment; Up to 6 months following treatment (Up to Month 12)
reported_events.desc: Safety population included all participants randomized to the treatment group who received at least 1 study device treatment or all participants randomized to the control group.

group.title: JUVÉDERM VOLUMA® XC
group.description: JUVÉDERM VOLUMA® XC was injected into the chin at a volume determined by the investigator on Day 0. Participants were eligible to receive touch-up treatment 30 days later, if applicable. The maximum total volume administered was up to 4 mL for both treatments combined.

group.title: No Treatment
group.description: Participants who received no treatment for the first 6 months.

group.title: JUVÉDERM VOLUMA® XC After No Treatment
group.description: Participants who received optional treatment with JUVÉDERM VOLUMA® XC injected into the chin at a volume determined by the investigator on Month 6 after no treatment for 6 months. Participants were eligible to receive touch-up treatment 30 days later, if applicable. The maximum total volume administered was up to 4 mL for both treatments combined.

category.title: Neoplasms benign, malignant and unspecified (incl cysts and polyps)

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: A disclosure restriction on the PI is that the sponsor can review results communications prior to public release and can embargo communications regarding trial results for a period that is less than or equal to 90 days from the time submitted to the sponsor for review. The sponsor cannot require changes to the communication and cannot extend the embargo.
